snippet: Daimler's chief executive said "different types" of cooperation with Apple and Google are possible as carmakers realize next-generation autos cannot be built without greater input from telecoms and software experts.

headline.main: Daimler CEO Mulls JVs With Apple, Google: Magazine
headline.print_headline: Daimler CEO Mulls JVs With Apple, Google: Magazine

snippet: Consumer electronics company Apple Inc has hired a senior engineer from electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc, according to a LinkedIn posting, as part of Apple's effort to build a team of experts in automated driving.

headline.main: Tesla Engineer Joins Apple's Growing Team of Automated Car Experts
headline.print_headline: Tesla Engineer Joins Apple's Growing Team of Automated Car Experts

snippet: Kings Dominion theme park says it plans to open a new thrill ride that it calls Delirium and describes as a swinging pendulum in the spring of 2016.

headline.main: Kings Dominion to Open New Thrill Ride Delirium in 2016
headline.print_headline: Kings Dominion to Open New Thrill Ride Delirium in 2016

snippet: iTunes' Official Music Charts for the week ending Aug. 20, 2015:

headline.main: The Top 10 Songs and Albums on the iTunes Store
headline.print_headline: The Top 10 Songs and Albums on the iTunes Store

snippet: Several major Hollywood studios failed to persuade a federal judge to dismiss a antitrust lawsuit accusing them of illegally conspiring not to poach each others' animators, to help drive down wages.

headline.main: Hollywood Studios Must Face Animators' Anti-Poaching Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Hollywood Studios Must Face Animators' Anti-Poaching Lawsuit

snippet: “Straight Outta Compton” ignored old allegations that Dr. Dre abused women. They resurfaced anyway.
abstract: Rapper Dr Dre publicly expresses regrets for his past behavior after history of his violence against women resurfaced during promotion of Straight Outta Compton, biopic about his hip-hop group NWA; women at center of allegations have reached out to thank those on social media who have helped them connect and spread their stories.

headline.main: Dr. Dre Apologizes to the ‘Women I’ve Hurt’
headline.print_headline: Dr. Dre, Trailed by Brutal Past, Apologizes to ‘Women I’ve Hurt’

snippet: Smartphone apps that help people learn languages for free or nearly free, a few sentences at a time, are piling pressure on established education firms and setting the pace for how to make lessons more engaging.

headline.main: Mobile Language Apps Help Millions Learn Less, More Often
headline.print_headline: Mobile Language Apps Help Millions Learn Less, More Often

snippet: Handmade wares from before the Industrial Revolution are inspiring a wealth of exhibitions and lectures.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; ceramics, clay wares revered for their practicality and folk art aesthetic, is focus of writings, documentary, exhibits and three-day conference in Colonial Williamsburg.

headline.main: A Rich Lode of American Ceramics Discoveries

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Albuquerque Museum of Art and History

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Museum of Early Southern Decorative Arts

snippet: Even before three firefighter deaths Wednesday, fire managers had been struggling to find enough staff to combat blazes in the Northwest and Northern California.
abstract: Ferocious and quickly-spreading fire season across Western states, one of region's worst wildfire summers on record, continues to consume acreage and manpower as firefighting teams pour in from across multiple states; tragedy is escalated when three firefighters are killed after their vehicle crashes and becomes trapped in moving blaze in Chelan, Washington.

headline.main: Western Wildfires Consume Manpower and Acreage
headline.print_headline: Wildfires Consume Manpower and Acreage Across the West

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON and FERNANDA SANTOS

snippet: A listing of discussions, film screenings, cultural activities and walking tours in New York City.
